questions.question: How do I choose the right chastity cage size for me?
questions.answer:
Choosing the right chastity cage size is crucial for comfort and security. 
Follow these steps: 

1. Measure the Back Ring's circumference and calculate the diameter. 
2. Choose from circular, curved/oval, or curved hinged rings. 
3. Measure the Cage Length (flaccid) and subtract 1/4 to 1/2 inch for fit. 
4. Measure the Cage Internal Diameter by wrapping a string around and dividing by Pi (3.14). 
5. Consider the Gap between cage and ring based on body characteristics. 

For more info, visit [House of Denial](https://www.houseofdenial.com/pages/how-to-measure-your-chastity-cage-and-ring-size).

questions.question: How to clean and maintain a chastity cage?
questions.answer:
Cleaning and maintaining a chastity cage is important to ensure hygiene and longevity of the device. Here are some steps to follow:

1. Removal: If you are wearing the chastity cage, carefully remove it by unlocking it using the provided keys or combination.
2. Disassemble: Take apart the cage by separating the rings, cage portion, and any additional components, such as locks or spacers. Refer to the user manual for specific instructions, as designs may differ.
3. Wash: Clean the components with warm water and mild antibacterial soap. Gently scrub all surfaces, focusing on any grooves or crevices where dirt or bacteria may collect. Do not use harsh chemicals or abrasive materials, as they can damage the cage.
4. Rinse: Thoroughly rinse all parts with clean water to remove any soap residue.
5. Dry: Pat dry or air dry the components to ensure they are completely moisture-free. Avoid using a hairdryer or high heat, as it can warp or damage the cage.
6. Lubrication: Apply a water-based lubricant or personal moisturizer to the parts that make contact with your skin. This helps reduce friction and discomfort when wearing the chastity cage.
7. Reassemble: Put the parts back together, ensuring they are securely attached. Double-check that all locking mechanisms are functioning correctly.
8. Storage: Store the chastity cage in a clean, dry place. Consider using a breathable storage bag or box to protect it from dust or damage.

Maintenance tips:
- Clean the chastity cage regularly, especially after extended wear or any sexual activities.
- Avoid wearing the cage for prolonged periods to allow your skin to breathe and reduce the risk of skin irritation or infections.
- Listen to your body and remove the cage if you experience any discomfort, numbness, or pain.
- If the chastity cage includes any additional materials like leather or fabric, clean them separately according to their specific care instructions.

For more info, visit: [Blog on Proper Hygiene](https://blog.lockedinlust.com/chastity/how-to-maintain-proper-hygiene-when-in-chastity), [Easy Steps to Clean and Disinfect Your Chastity Cage](https://maleleatherchastity.wordpress.com/2018/10/05/easy-steps-to-clean-and-disinfect-your-chastity-cage/), [Clean Your Chastity Device](https://www.thechaingang.com/blog/clean-chastity-device/).
